channel.title: ::starter command help

item.title: ::starter command help
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Using a field in a class that is reassigned every time a connection occurs (or multithreading) for checking that sort of a thing is not going to work. Hint: Try another method, such as the declaration of a HashSet in perhaps PlayerHandler?

Read full topic

item.title: ::starter command help
item.dc:creator: @purez4life purez4life
item.description:
@purez4life wrote:

I don’t like players to log out then back in to do ::starter again, how do I make it so they can only do the command once?

Here’s my ::starter code

        }

        if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {	
            if (starter == 0) {
                addItem(995, 10000000);
                addItem(392, 1337);
                addItem(1050, 1);
                addItem(554, 1337);
                addItem(555, 1337);
                addItem(565, 1337);
                addItem(556, 1337);
                addItem(557, 1337);
                addItem(560, 1337);
                addItem(561, 1337);
                addItem(562, 1337);
                addItem(563, 1337);
                addItem(566, 1337);
                addItem(558, 1337);
                sendMessage("Here you go, " + playerName + "! Enjoy JetPK.");
                starter = 1;
                savemoreinfo();
                savechar();
            } else if (starter == 1) {
                sendMessage("Sorry " + playerName + ", but... ");
                PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName
                        + " is a noob that wants more than one starter package! XD");

            }
        }

Can anyone help?
Edit: I’m still relatively new to coding, I’ve only done so much

Read full topic
